reasoning: Type 1 Gaucher disease (non-neuronopathic) incidence estimated at ~1.8 per 100,000 live births globally based on multiple population registries. Type 1 is the most common form (~90% of Gaucher cases). Moderate confidence due to geographic variation (higher in Ashkenazi Jewish populations, lower in other populations) and variation across studies.
source: Meikle PJ et al. (2006). Prevalence of lysosomal storage disorders. JAMA. 296(8):949-951
